node.html: A simple FPS game made as a submission for One Minute Jam. You can know more about it here.
An OCD trigger for real artists, but Among Us in 3D. Implemented map, player movement, vents and tasks.. and then abandoned for networking horrors.
This app was made during the first-ever Toycathon organised by the govt. of India. Our team qualified to the Grand Finale of the hackathon in the Digital Toys Track.

Beat Shabber is a simplified clone version of the popular VR game Beat Saber, where you smash crates on the beats of songs. OpenCV Blob detection has been used to detect user motion and thereby move the saber across the screen. The crates are spawned as per the beats detected in the song in real time.

Fleet is an RSA encrypted realtime chat application, based on Firebase Realtime Database.

It uses SQLite for local chat storage, Firebase Authentication for account verification, and Firebase Storage to store the public keys and profile pictures of each user. The Realtime Database does not store any messages post delivery.
A basic firebase realtime database based clipboard app that syncs your saved entries from the clipboard into the cloud database for prolonged, inter-device access.
Created a basic Java bot using Selenium library to attend scheduled Google Meet sessions. Found most of these projects in Python, so went on to recreate a popular idea in a different language, Java.
A 2-hour sprint at making a basic playable game without accessing the internet. It's just a survival game where you avoid the falling stones and the tangled creepers to survive.

Air-Mouse is an Android App coupled with a Windows PC Client, which uses the phone's Gyroscope sensors to control the mouse cursor on the PC, based on the phoneâ€™s orientation and tilt. Built using Unity and Visual Studio, it implements TCP to transfer sensor data buffer.
